de.mrapp.android.dialog.model

Interface Dialog

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    AnimateableDialog, AnimateableDialogDecorator, ButtonBarDialog, ButtonBarDialogDecorator, DialogDecorator, HeaderDialog, HeaderDialogDecorator, ListDialog, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ProgressDialogDecorator, ScrollableDialog, ScrollableDialogDecorator, ValidateableDialog, ValidateableDialogDecorator
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractAnimateableDialog, AbstractButtonBarDialog, AbstractDialogDecorator, AbstractDialogFragmentDecorator, AbstractHeaderDialog, AbstractHeaderDialogFragment, AbstractListDialog, AbstractMaterialDialog, AbstractMaterialDialogFragment, AbstractScrollableDialog, AbstractValidateableDialog, AnimateableDialogDecorator, ButtonBarDialogDecorator, HeaderDialogDecorator, ListDialogDecorator, MaterialDialog, MaterialDialogDecorator, ProgressDialog, ProgressDialogDecorator, ScrollableDialogDecorator, ValidateableDialogDecorator, WizardDialog, WizardDialogDecorator

    public interface Dialog
    Defines the interface, all dialogs must implement.
    Since:
    3.2.0

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Dialog.Gravity
      Contains all flags, which can be used to specify a dialog's gravity.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int MATCH_PARENT
      Special value for the height or width requested by a dialog.
      static int WRAP_CONTENT
      Special value for the height or width requested by a dialog.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      android.content.Context getContext()
      Returns the context, which is used by the dialog.

    • Field Detail

      • MATCH_PARENT

        static final int MATCH_PARENT
        Special value for the height or width requested by a dialog. MATCH_PARENT means that the dialog wants to be as big as the window, minus the dialog's margin, if any.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • WRAP_CONTENT

        static final int WRAP_CONTENT
        Special value for the height or width requested by a dialog. WRAP_CONTENT means that the dialog wants to be just large enough to fit its own internal content, taking its own padding into account.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        android.content.Context getContext()
        Returns the context, which is used by the dialog.
        Returns:
        The context, which is used by the dialog, as an instance of the class Context
